content: st * repeat between * s until the work in 🄵 the main colour measures if adding leg straps do not cut the yarn section 4 finishing touches leg straps i love the addition of the leg straps and hope you do to they really improve the fit and the belly strap can be narrower meaning the jumper stays cleaner for longer you can see here that the leg strap comes from the last row around the leg and joins around 6 row up the jumper flap 🄶 18 at the end of your final row for the jumper flap make a chain the length of try the jumper on and make sure the strap is comfortable for your pup it should sit tightly against the leg as it will stretch over time identify and mark the point where the strap should join to the jumper flap see image below take the jumper off and join the chain with a slip_stitch to the marked point single_crochet in the back bump of the second chain from the hook and the back bump of each chain along 19 continue to single_crochet across the final row of the jumper flap so that you can make the leg strap for the other side repeat step 17 join to the last single_crochet with an invisible join 20 cut the yarn and weave in ends leg trim the leg trim gives a nice finish and will strengthen the leg holes 21 join the contrast colour yarn to the leg hole and make 1 single_crochet in each stitch around cut the yarn and weave in ends repeat for second leg hole edging another extra but if you have enough contrast yarn this really finishes the jumper off nicely and hides the join of the leg straps 22 attach contrast yarn to the belly strap single_crochet in each st across until you get to the jumper flap continue working single_crochet evenly up the side of the jumper flap across the straight edge of the jumper flap and down the other side to finish off continue working 1 single_crochet in each st of the belly strap join with an invisible join cut the yarn and weave in ends and there you have it one bespoke doggie jumper be sure to tag me in your
